review_text:
Overall, rating this an okay stay could be considered generous. I think we may have just had a series of mishaps that just soured the experience a little for us but i'm not sure. The more I think about this space and our experience the more I wonder if I am just being overly kind. I'm not sure that my experience is a reflection of the usual happenings here but as a super host myself, I owe it to future guests to report my experience so here we go.
The host has you enter through the back door, which is fine but it was pouring rain so we had to traipse through the muddy, wet grass (with a newborn) so just be prepared for that especially in snowy or rainy weather. There is no path...just grass. Kitchen has very little counterspace, so most food prep will have to be done on the kitchen table. We didn't stay long enough to cook, but something I noticed. Huge pantry off the kitchen appeared to have some fun stuff in it like (if I remember correctly) a crockpot, large roasting pan and coffee maker (among other things). Speaking of coffee...there was none. We found a canister that had a few coffee grounds in it. It certainly smelled like coffee....had evidence of coffee grounds in the past...just no coffee in it currently. Apparently coffee isn't listed as an amenity which is weird since there is coffee filters and creamer and sugar packets. Anyway, coffee places nearby...or bring your own grounds.
Speaking of kitchen...there was like 6 pieces of mouse poop in the kitchen sink and one right next to the sponge. I brought this to the host's attention. To his credit, he offered to send a cleaner over right away who could clean the kitchen as well as bring us more towels since I pointed out there were only 2 bath towels despite there being 3 adults and a baby booked for the night. I declined the cleaner as it was 11 pm and my sister (with her newborn) were already in bed after our long day of travel. I decided to let him bring the towels because he was only 5 minutes away and was trying to make it right and I felt bad. Upong arrival with clean towels, host was very apologetic, sincere and kind, which I really appreciated. However, we discovered the next morning, after three days of travel, we were unable to use the towels our host brought as the Airbnb did not provide shower gel, shampoo or conditioner (which I normally travel with but of course I forgot on this trip)....so I *guess* it's not his fault, however rough for us after 3 days of not showering.
Sheets in one bedroom were pilly and, therefore, rough like sandpaper. I was going to sleep on the futon, but discovered I "couldn't" because the house manual requested I only do so with the sheets and bedding provided. Spare bedding was suppose to be in drawers under the queen bed but were nowhere to be seen. My 42-yo self ended up sleeping in the bed with my 72-yo mom. Good thing we like each other. Probably worked out okay because both the living room couch and the futon would not have been comfortable overnight unless you are under 100 lbs.
I don't know....maybe I screwed this one up. Maybe I didn't pay close enough attention to things like the $100 cleaning fee WHICH IS RIDICULOUSLY HIGH. Maybe I should have done a street view of the area first to see if the area was sketchy. Perhaps I should have checked amenities to see if they would have the BASIC stuff a hotel would have like shampoo, conditioner and coffee. As an Airbnb Superhost myself, I feel like I should take the blame for all of my many mistakes in choosing this location. But then again, maybe they could just do better. I dunno. You decide. For me? 10/10 would not stay again. Too many things went wrong. Cost was excessive for what it was. Location 5/10. Thank god it was only one measly night.

Cons: Cooling could not keep up during hot/humid stay. Cooled down overnight, but during the 100 degree days it was 75-78 although stat was set to 68. No TVs :( Traffic noise from the highway was loud starting at 5:30am, so bring a sleep machine or fan.
